title: An Investigation of the Potential Benefits of Big Data in the Public Sector of Mauritius
analysis_techniques: Causal layered analysis; Futures wheel; PEST analysis
research_description: The study examines how big data analytics could optimize the use of public funds while ensuring the delivery of quality service by public organizations to citizens in Mauritius. It applies PEST analysis to identify major policies and initiatives related to big data and uses causal layered analysis (CLA) to create transformative scenarios for alternative futures.
research_results: The findings highlight that the implementation of open data initiatives and e-health projects in Mauritius would have positive impacts, but reforms in existing laws are needed to fully leverage the potential of big data applications. The study also emphasizes the importance of transparent policies for the successful use of big data.
future_research: Future research could explore additional government sectors where big data analytics can be applied and investigate the impact of legal reforms on the adoption of big data technologies in Mauritius.
